intro: Echinocereus enneacanthus var. enneacanthus, commonly known as the Arizona hedgehog cactus, is a species native to the Sonoran Desert. It is a columnar cactus with a distinctive appearance, featuring a tall, spiny stem and clusters of bright yellow flowers. The plant has a shallow root system and thrives in well-drained sandy or gravelly soils. It is adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established. Its spines provide protection from herbivores and help reduce water loss through transpiration.
